DataElement.preferredName: Patient History Hepatitis C Virus Infection Therapeutic Procedure Occurrence And Undetectable HCV Viral Load Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine clinical trial participation for questions related to the patient's medical background regarding an infection that is caused by hepatitis C virus, the administration of therapeutic agents, and undetectable HCV viral load as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Personal Medical History Hepatitis C Virus Infection Therapeutic Procedure Occurrence And Undetectable Hepatitis C Virus Viral Load Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._An infection that is caused by hepatitis C virus._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The inability to be noticed, identified or discovered._A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame._The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Personal Medical History Hepatitis C Virus Infection Therapeutic Procedure Occurrence And Undetectable Hepatitis C Virus Viral Load Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:An infection that is caused by hepatitis C virus.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The inability to be noticed, identified or discovered.:A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame.:The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
An infection that is caused by hepatitis C virus.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The inability to be noticed, identified or discovered.
A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame.
The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has a history of H
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, have they been treated and have an undetectable HCV viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have they been treated and cured?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has isolated positive hepatitis B core antibody (i.e., in the setting of negative hepatitis B surface antigen and negative hepatitis B surface antibody), is hepatitis B viral load undetectable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been screened for HCV up to 28 days prior to study drug using standard virus lab panel, and if positive for anti-HCV antibody are they negative for HCV RNA?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, have they been treated and have an undetectable HCV viral load (polymerase chain reaction is negative for HCV RNA)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, have they been treated and cured, or if patient is currently on treatment, they have an undetectable HCV viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has known chronic Hepatitis C (HCV) infection, have they been treated and cured, or if patient is currently on treatment, they have an undetectable HCV viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has a history of Hepatitis C, have they been treated and cured?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has a history of hepatitis C infection, does the patient have undetectable viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, have they been treated and cured, or if currently on treatment, the patient has an undetectable HCV viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, have they been treated and cured, or if patient is currently on treatment that does not interact with study therapy, they have an undetectable HCV viral load (e.g. HCV RNA [qualitative] not detected)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, have they been treated and cured, or if patient is currently on treatment that does not interact with study therapy, they have an undetectable HCV viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has a history of Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, have they been treated and cured?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, have they been treated and cured with an undetectable HCV viral load, or if currently on treatment, the patient has an undetectable HCV viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, does the patient have an undetectable HCV viral load due to prior treatment or natural resolution?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a known history of Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, have they been treated and cured, or if currently on treatment, the patient has an undetectable HCV viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, is polymerase chain reaction (PCR) negative for HCV RNA and if patient is currently on treatment, do they have an undetectable HCV viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, have they been treated and cured including self-cured cases, or if currently on treatment, the patient has an undetectable HCV viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, have they been treated and undetectable HCV viral load 12 or more weeks after treatment completion or if currently on treatment, they have an undetectable HCV viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, have they been treated and cured, or if currently on treatment, the patient has an undetectable HCV viral load within 28 days of enrollment?

DataElement.changeDescription: 11/1/18 TMT released. 10-2-18 tmt/10200. Deleted duplicated AQT per LK. AK 2020-4-28
